TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SshPublicKey extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains information about SSH certificate public key and the path on the Linux VM where the public key is placed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Public Sub New (Optional path As String = null, Optional keyData As String = null)
SshPublicKey(std::wstring const & path = null, std::wstring const & keyData = null);

Docs.param: Specifies the full path on the created VM where ssh public key is stored. If the file already exists, the specified key is appended to the file. Example: /home/user/.ssh/authorized_keys

SSH public key certificate used to authenticate with the VM through ssh. The key needs to be at least 2048-bit and in ssh-rsa format.

For creating ssh keys, see [Create SSH keys on Linux and Mac for Linux VMs in Azure](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-linux-mac-create-ssh-keys?toc=%2fazure%2fvirtual-machines%2flinux%2ftoc.json).
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SshPublicKey class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets SSH public key certificate used to authenticate with the VM through ssh. The key needs to be at least 2048-bit and in ssh-rsa format. <br><br> For creating ssh keys, see [Create SSH keys on Linux and Mac for Linux VMs in Azure](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/virtual-machines/virtual-machines-linux-mac-create-ssh-keys?toc=%2fazure%2fvirtual-machines%2flinux%2ftoc.json).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets specifies the full path on the created VM where ssh public key is stored. If the file already exists, the specified key is appended to the file. Example: /home/user/.ssh/authorized_keys
